temple.title: Drikhung Rinpoche Monastery
temple.subtitle: A Sacred Haven of Peace and Enlightenment
temple.description: Nestled in the Himalayan foothills, Drikhung Rinpoche Monastery stands as a beacon of Tibetan Buddhist tradition. Founded in the 14th century, this sacred site preserves ancient wisdom while embracing global spirituality. The monastery's golden roofs and intricate mandalas represent the path to enlightenment, inspiring visitors from across the world.
temple.info: The monastery is home to a community of dedicated monks who maintain daily rituals, scholarly pursuits, and meditation practices. Visitors are welcome to witness prayer ceremonies, explore the ancient libraries, and experience the profound spiritual atmosphere that has remained unchanged for centuries.

hours.title: Visiting Hours
hours.content: Daily from 9:00 AM to 5:00 PM, extended to 8:00 PM on ceremony days (1st and 15th day of lunar month)

temple.history: Drikhung Rinpoche Monastery was established in the Wood Horse Year of the 7th Rabjung Cycle (1234 CE), consecrated by the great Jonang master Töndrub Rinpoche. It stands as one of the most sacred monasteries of the Gelug tradition of Tibetan Buddhism. Through nearly 800 years of history, including three major reconstructions, the monastery has faithfully guarded six extraordinary sacred treasures: an authentic relic of Buddha Shakyamuni, the Thousand-Year Eternal Butter Lamp, the Seven-Colored Vajra, the Speaking Tara Thangka, the Never-Wilting Lotus, and the world-renowned Pure Gold Buddha—a 9.8-meter tall Maitreya Buddha statue crafted from 8.6 tons of pure gold, one of the largest pure gold Buddha statues in the world.
temple.location: The monastery is nestled in the sacred eastern region of the Himalayas at an altitude of 4,527 meters. With Mount Kailash (Gang Rinpoche) at its back and the sacred Lake Manasarovar (Mapam Yumtso) before it, surrounded by majestic peaks, it is perpetually enveloped in spiritual energy and renowned as 'The Land of Spiritual Veins'—a truly sacred site of Buddhist dharma.
temple.monks: The monastery is currently home to 1 Living Buddha, 3 Rinpoches, 5 Khenpos, and 189 practicing monks who engage in daily chanting, worship, and spiritual practice without interruption. Pilgrims from around the world continuously visit to seek blessings, wisdom, peace, and prosperity.

introduction.highlight: Drikhung Rinpoche Monastery is a significant sacred site of the Gelug lineage of Tibetan Buddhism with over 600 years of rich history.
introduction.p1: Founded in 1387 by Jamyang Choje, an eminent disciple of Je Tsongkhapa, the monastery is renowned for its magnificent architecture, rich collection of Buddhist texts, and rigorous spiritual lineage. The golden roofs glitter in the sunlight, symbolizing the luminosity of Buddha's wisdom.
introduction.p2: The monastery houses thousands of precious Buddhist scriptures and thangkas, including rare treasures. Most notable is a 15-foot pure gold statue of Buddha Shakyamuni that draws countless devotees daily. The walls are adorned with exquisite murals depicting Buddha's life and the essence of Buddhist teachings.

significance.p1: Drikhung Rinpoche Monastery serves as a vital center for Buddhist practice, where monks engage in continuous rituals and spiritual practices day and night. The monastery hosts several major ceremonies throughout the year, particularly the Tibetan New Year blessing ceremony that attracts devotees from around the world.
significance.p2: In Tibetan Buddhism, this monastery holds a special position and is believed to possess extraordinary blessing power. It is said that praying once at this monastery equals praying a hundred times at other temples. Many aspire to make at least one pilgrimage to this sacred site in their lifetime to absorb its spiritual energy.

location.p1: Drikhung Rinpoche Monastery is situated in the sacred eastern region of the Himalayas at an altitude of 4,527 meters. With Mount Kailash at its back and Lake Manasarovar at its front, it is naturally positioned at a spiritual nexus.
location.p2: Surrounded by majestic mountains, the scenery is breathtaking and the atmosphere is perpetually charged with spiritual energy. The best time to visit is from May to October when the weather is clear and roads are accessible. Winter visits, though challenging due to road conditions, offer a more serene and mystical experience.

quote.text: When the mind is pure, all lands in the ten directions become pure lands; when the mind is defiled, even sitting on a golden lotus cannot bring liberation. Drikhung Rinpoche Monastery is a place for purifying the mind; with a pure mind, Buddha's land becomes pure.
quote.author: The 7th Kyabje Rinpoche of Drikhung Lineage

donate.title: Sacred Offerings
donate.subtitle: Cultivating Merit through Generosity
donate.description: Every offering supports the preservation of sacred texts, maintenance of holy structures, and continuation of daily rituals. According to Buddha's teachings, the act of giving (Dana) not only benefits others but cultivates positive karma and spiritual merit for one's path to enlightenment.
donate.thankyou: We rejoice in your virtuous generosity
donate.note: All offerings support the monastery's operations, sustenance of the sangha, restoration of sacred texts, and dharma propagation. Of all offerings, the offering of dharma is supreme. Your compassionate generosity, like nectar nourishing the Bodhi tree, brings immeasurable merit.
donate.thanks: We are deeply grateful for your compassionate gesture. May Buddha bless you with inner peace, auspicious circumstances, wisdom and merit in equal measure, and six-fold prosperity.

history.title: Rich Heritage
history.content: Established in 1387 during the peak of Tibetan Buddhist expansion, Drikhung Rinpoche Monastery represents the unbroken lineage of the Gelug tradition. Founded by the revered master Jamyang Choje, a direct disciple of Je Tsongkhapa, the monastery houses rare scriptures, ancient relics, and sacred artifacts that survived through centuries. Its distinctive architecture features intricate wood carvings, gold-leafed roofs, and vibrant thangka paintings that depict Buddhist cosmology and spiritual teachings. The monastery's main prayer hall can accommodate over 300 monks during grand ceremonies and contains a 15-foot gold-plated statue of Buddha Shakyamuni.

mission.title: Spiritual Purpose
mission.content: Drikhung Rinpoche Monastery serves as a center for spiritual practice, education, and the preservation of Tibetan Buddhist wisdom. The resident monastic community maintains daily rituals that have continued uninterrupted for over six centuries, including dawn prayers, meditation sessions, philosophical debates, and butter lamp offerings. Our monastery is committed to making these ancient practices accessible to modern practitioners worldwide through both traditional teachings and digital platforms. We believe in the universal applicability of Buddhist principles of compassion, wisdom, and mindfulness as tools for cultivating inner peace and harmonious societies.

community.title: Global Sangha
community.content: Today, our monastery connects with devotees across continents through this digital platform, allowing sincere practitioners to participate in prayers, make offerings, and receive blessings regardless of physical distance. The monastery hosts annual retreats, empowerment ceremonies, and teaching sessions led by venerated lamas and realized practitioners. Our online prayer system enables the global Buddhist community to request prayers for special occasions, healing, or remembrance of loved ones. These digital prayers are printed on traditional prayer flags and raised during special ceremonies at the monastery, creating a bridge between ancient tradition and modern technology. Join our global community in preserving and practicing these precious teachings for the benefit of all beings.
